Article Title: Bharat Coking Coal IPO: Stock lists strongly at over 95% premium; makes strong debut
Article Text:
Representative image (AI-generated)

(Disclaimer: Recommendations and views on the stock market, other asset classes or personal finance management tips given by experts are their own. These opinions do not represent the views of The Times of India)

Shares of Bharat Coking Coal Limited (BCCL) made a strong debut on the stock exchanges on Monday, nearly doubling from their issue price after the company‚Äôs Rs 1,071 crore initial public offering drew overwhelming investor demand.The stock listed at Rs 45 on the NSE, a premium of 95.6% over the issue price of Rs 23 and at Rs 45.21 on the BSE, marking a gain of 96.6%. Ahead of listing, the company was valued at around Rs 10,711 crore.The IPO, which was open for subscription from January 9 to January 13, was entirely an offer for sale by promoter Coal India Limited and did not involve any fresh capital raise. Proceeds from the issue went to the promoter, while public shareholding increased following the listing.Investor interest in the issue was exceptionally strong, with the IPO subscribed 147 times overall. Demand was high across all categories, led by non-institutional investors, while qualified institutional buyers also oversubscribed their portion multiple times. Retail participation was also strong.Market participants had widely expected a strong listing, supported by high grey market premiums and the company‚Äôs strategic role in India‚Äôs steel value chain.Analysts said that the debut reflected confidence in Bharat Coking Coal‚Äôs dominant position in the domestic coking coal segment.Gaurav Garg, research analyst at Lemon Markets Desk, said the response to the issue highlighted investor belief in the company‚Äôs long-term prospects.‚ÄúThe strong response to the Bharat Coking Coal IPO underscores investor confidence in the company‚Äôs monopolistic position in India‚Äôs coking coal segment and its long-term demand visibility,‚Äù he said.Garg added that the anchor book provided early validation, while heavy non-institutional participation signalled expectations of listing gains.Bharat Coking Coal is India‚Äôs largest producer of coking coal and the only significant domestic supplier of prime coking coal, a key raw material for steel production.Incorporated in 1972, the company operates 34 mines across the Jharia coalfields in Jharkhand and the Raniganj coalfields in West Bengal, comprising both underground and opencast operations. Its key customers include steel producers and power companies.As of April 2024, the company‚Äôs estimated coking coal reserves stood at about 7.91 billion tonnes, accounting for nearly 21.5% of India‚Äôs total coking coal resources. In FY25, Bharat Coking Coal produced around 58.5% of the country‚Äôs domestic coking coal output.The company has steadily ramped up production in recent years. Coal output increased from 30.5 million tonnes in FY22 to about 40.5 million tonnes in FY25, supported by mine expansions, the reopening of discontinued underground mines and efficiency improvements at coal washeries.On the financial front, Bharat Coking Coal reported revenue of Rs 14,401‚Äì14,402 crore and a profit after tax of Rs 1,240 crore in FY25. While earnings have seen some volatility due to fluctuations in coal prices and costs, the company remains debt-free and cash-generative. As of September 2025, it had total assets of Rs 18,711 crore and a net worth of Rs 5,831 crore.Following the listing, Coal India‚Äôs shareholding in Bharat Coking Coal has reduced to about 90% from 100%, improving the public float while retaining government control.As a wholly owned subsidiary earlier, BCCL has benefited from Coal India‚Äôs technical expertise, financial strength and operational scale.Analysts see the stock as a long-term play linked to India‚Äôs infrastructure push and growth in steel demand, though they caution that near-term performance will depend on broader market conditions and trends in coal pricing.‚ÄúThe scarcity value of a pure-play coking coal producer and steady demand from the steel sector support favourable secondary market sentiment,‚Äù Garg said. He added that investors should track earnings consistency over time.
Article Summary: Shares of bharat coking coal limited (bccl) made a strong debut on the stock exchanges on monday, nearly doubling from their issue price. The company‚Äôs rs 1,071 crore initial public offering drew overwhelming investor demand. The stock listed at rs 45 on the nse, a premium of 95.6% over the issue price of rs 23.

Article Title: MLB trade rumors: New York Mets might acquire $10 million Philadelphia Phillies star to bolster team before deadline
Article Text:
Metsburst cover SuperJumbo (Image via Getty)

(Disclaimer: The data and analysis in this post are based on conjecture as of right now. Although the information is based on reliable sources, it's crucial to remember that these are not official declarations or verified actions.

It is advised that readers use caution when interpreting this analysis and wait for official updates as the offseason progresses.)

How the Nimmo Trade Reshaped the New York Mets

Why Max Kepler Is on the New York Mets‚Äô Radar

What the New York Mets Gain and Weighing Risks

The New York Mets are adjusting after parting ways with a player who spent nearly a decade with the organization. With Brandon Nimmo now in Texas, the front office is focused on finding a short-term outfield option that limits spending and avoids long-term commitments.That approach has led them to Max Kepler. He is not viewed as a marquee signing but as a steady replacement. A reported one-year deal worth $7.6 million would give the Mets reliable defense and left-handed power while preserving roster flexibility.The New York Mets‚Äô direction changed after a one-for-one trade with the Texas Rangers sent Nimmo to Texas in exchange for second baseman Marcus Semien. Nimmo waived his full no-trade clause to complete the deal, ending his eight-year, $162 million tenure in New York.Nimmo was still productive in 2025. He appeared in 143 games and hit .261 with 23 home runs and 82 RBIs.Even so, the Mets chose to address their infield and manage payroll. Semien now anchors second base, but the trade left a clear vacancy in left field.Max Kepler became a free agent after a one-year, $10 million season with Philadelphia that was limited by knee issues. His surface numbers declined, but the Mets value his defense and remaining power. In 2025, he ranked among the league‚Äôs best outfield arms and fits cleanly into a corner role.A short-term deal also matches the Mets‚Äô plans. Prospect Carson Benge is expected to push for a larger role soon, and Max Kepler would fill the gap without blocking that path. The lower salary compared to Nimmo‚Äôs deal also leaves room to address pitching.Max Kepler would bring reliable defense in the corner outfield, a strong arm, and pop against right-handed pitching without a big price tag. His expected salary is well below Brandon Nimmo‚Äôs yearly average, giving the Mets a way to add value while staying mindful of the luxury tax.The concerns are durability and age. Kepler is in his mid-30s and coming off a down year. He also does not solve the center-field situation long term, leaving the Mets to rely on internal options.Also read: MLB trade rumors: Cincinnati Reds predicted to sign $10.2 million New York Yankees; Brady Singer key trade asset? Even with those risks, the move fits the moment. The New York Mets stay competitive, protect their payroll, and keep a clear path open for younger players.
Article Summary: Max kepler would bring reliable defense in the corner outfield, a strong arm, and pop against right-handed pitching without a big price tag. His expected salary is well below brandon nimmo‚Äôs yearly average, giving the mets a way to add value while staying mindful of the luxury tax. Kepler is in his mid-30s and coming off a down year.

Article Title: Andre Agassi and Steffi Graf 2016 to 2026 joint net worth breakdown: Inside the famous tennis power couple wealth and family life after retirement
Article Text:
Andre Agassi and Steffi Graf 2016 to 2026 joint net worth breakdown: How the famous tennis power couple grew wealth after retirement (Image via Getty)

Andre Agassi net worth journey from 2016 to 2026

Steffi Graf net worth growth and long-term earnings

Andre Agassi and Steffi Graf business and investment choices

Andre Agassi and Steffi Graf recent appearances and public moments

Andre Agassi and Steffi Graf are two of the biggest names tennis has ever seen. They married in 2001 and built a life far beyond the court. From 2016 to 2026, their money story stayed steady, smart, and calm. There were no risky moves, just old deals, safe business choices, and a focus on family. Today, their combined net worth is estimated at around $290 million.Andre Agassi earned about $31 million in prize money during his tennis career, according to ATP records. But most of his wealth came after tennis. By 2016, his net worth was already estimated at $145 million, as reported by Celebrity Net Worth and Forbes.From 2016 to 2026, Andre did not chase new sports titles. Instead, he stayed active in business. He invested in fitness clubs, education projects, and real estate. He also stayed connected to tennis as a mentor and event leader. His long-time endorsement deals with brands like Nike and Canon continued to add value even years after retirement.Steffi Graf earned close to $22 million in prize money, according to WTA records. Like Andre, her real money came from endorsements. Adidas was her biggest partner and stayed with her for decades.By 2016, her net worth was also estimated at $145 million, according to Forbes and Celebrity Net Worth. From 2016 to 2026, Steffi kept a very low profile. She focused on family, charity work, and private investments. She did not sign flashy new deals, but her past contracts and smart money planning kept her wealth stable.Together, Andre Agassi and Steffi Graf invested in hotels, real estate, and sports-related businesses through their private holding work, often reported by Business Insider. They also supported education projects, including Andre‚Äôs long-running school work in Las Vegas.Their goal was never fast growth. They focused on protecting what they had. That is why their combined net worth stayed strong from 2016 through 2026, instead of rising and falling with risky moves.In recent years, the couple has appeared at high-profile pickleball events, including the Pickleball Slam exhibitions in Las Vegas, covered by ESPN. Andre Agassi has also stayed active as a tennis voice during major tournaments.They spend most of their time with their children, Jaden Agassi and Jaz Elle Agassi, and avoid daily media attention.Andre Agassi is also linked to a new documentary project, reported by Netflix-focused media outlets, tied to his life, tennis journey, and legacy. The series is still in development and has not yet released full details, according to Netflix coverage reports.
Article Summary: Andre agassi and steffi graf are two of the biggest names tennis has ever seen. They married in 2001 and built a life far beyond the court. From 2016 to 2026, their money story stayed steady, smart, and calm. There were no risky moves, just old deals, safe business choices, and a focus on family.

Article Title: YouTube accused of quietly deleting custom subtitles across the platform
Article Text:
Image Via YouTube

YouTube accused of quietly removing custom subtitles used by creators





YouTube has come under criticism from content creators as well as translation teams for pulling down handcrafted subtitles submitted by users without prior notice, as has become apparent in the wake of reported cases about the situation. User-submitted subtitles have been an essential part of helping content creators reach a global audience through accurate translation and optimized viewing experiences, particularly in fast-paced videos, music videos, as well as multilingual live videos on YouTube.The issue has caused concern because YouTube has not made any public announcement explaining the change. While the platform provides auto-generated subtitles in several languages, creators often rely on custom subtitles to avoid errors, mistranslations, and timing problems. For international communities, these subtitles are more than a feature, they are essential for understanding content and staying connected with creators from different regions.According to creators and translators, YouTube is deleting subtitles created using an undocumented format known as SRV3. This format allowed for more detailed timing, styling, and presentation than standard subtitle options. It was commonly used for music videos, lyric syncing, and creative subtitle designs, particularly within VTuber and anime-style content communities.Several users on social media have claimed that subtitles have disappeared from older videos with millions of views, suggesting the issue is not a temporary bug. Some translation managers and production staff have stated that this confirms a planned platform change rather than an error. Because SRV3 was never officially supported, YouTube may be removing it as part of a technical cleanup or policy enforcement.The backlash has escalated as many of these subtitles cannot readily be replaced. The flexibility in the supported subtitle formats cannot be matched by other formats, and it will take time to recreate all this work. Fans will equally be harmed as subtitles assist them in understanding jokes and lyrics in the videos.As of yet, YouTube has not responded to these allegations, nor has the company stated if these removals will continue. This lack of communication has been frustrating for everyone and has led many creators to ask for the ability to save their already existing subtitles.The quiet removal of custom subtitles raised serious concerns about accessibility and creator support on YouTube. While the platform may have technical reasons for having made this change, the complete lack of communication has left creators and viewers confused and disappointed. Until YouTube addresses the issue, many fear that valuable translations and creative subtitle work could be lost permanently, limiting global access to content that once crossed language barriers.
Article Summary: Youtube accused of quietly removing custom subtitles used by creators and translators. Creator-submitted subtitles have been an essential part of helping content creators reach a global audience. Youtube has not responded to these allegations, nor has the company stated if these removals will continue.

Article Title: Quote of the day by Thomas A. Edison: ‚ÄúOpportunity is missed by most people because...‚Äù
Article Text:
Thomas Alva Edison (Image source: Wikipedia)

‚ÄúOpportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work‚Äù

Who was Thomas Alva Edison



What this Thomas Edison quote means



‚ÄúOpportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.‚Äù

Why this quote still matters



How people relate to it today







People remember Thomas A. Edison as one of the most important inventors. He worked on a lot of ideas and had thousands of patents over the course of his life. Many of his inventions are now a part of daily life, like the electric light bulb and sound recording devices. But Edison was known for more than just what he made. People also knew how he thought about work, hard work, and success., is one of the most popular things he has said. Edison talks about a simple habit that a lot of people have. People often look for opportunities in things that seem fun, easy, or rewarding right away. It's easier to ignore something when it looks hard or requires a lot of work. Edison thought this was where a lot of people went wrong. He says that opportunities don't usually come in a polished or attractive way. Instead, it often comes in a quiet way that looks like work that needs to be done.Thomas Alva Edison was born in 1847 in the US. He was curious about how things worked from a young age. As he got older, this curiosity turned into a habit of trying new things and making old ones better. Edison worked on many projects at once and thought that progress came from working hard over and over again instead of getting quick results.Some of the most important things he invented were the electric light bulb, phonograph, and the motion picture camera. He also built labs where groups of people could work together on long-term experiments. Edison thought that being patient, testing things out, and working hard every day were all important parts of coming up with new ideas. A lot of historical records say that he saw innovation as a normal part of his job, not a flash of genius.Edison said,He was using a simple picture to explain a common reaction. Overalls are clothes that people wear to do physical or practical work. Edison used this picture to show that opportunities often seem normal and hard to get.A lot of people think that success will come quickly or with little work. They might want results right away, without having to learn, practice, or fail along the way. Edison said that real opportunities usually require work first and pay off later. Because of this, people sometimes miss out on chances that could have helped them grow.This idea is still important because it shows how people make choices every day. Students might not want to study subjects that need more practice. Workers might not want to do tasks that seem hard. People may put off their personal goals if they seem hard or uncertain. Edison's words remind readers that trying hard doesn't mean you've failed; it usually means that something important is possible.The quote tells people to think about work in a new way. Instead of viewing work as a hindrance, it proposes perceiving it as an integral component of the opportunity.This quote is often used in classrooms, offices, and talks about how to grow as a person. Teachers use it to show how important it is to be consistent. Employers share it to show that hard work pays off in the long run. People think about it when they are deciding whether or not to take on tasks that need a lot of patience.Edison's words still ring true because they describe a reality that many people know. At first, opportunities may not seem appealing, but those who are willing to put in the work often reap the benefits in the end.
Article Summary: Thomas alva edison was born in 1847 in the us. He worked on a lot of ideas and had thousands of patents over the course of his life. People often look for opportunities in things that seem fun, easy, or rewarding right away. Edison said that real opportunities usually require work first and pay off later.

Article Title: Tom Brady turns to the past amid growing romance rumors with 25 year old popular influencer Alix Earle
Article Text:
Tom Brady turns to the past amid growing romance rumors with 25-year-old popular influencer Alix Earle.(Image via Getty Images)

Tom Brady reminisces about the past amid dating rumors with Alix Earle



Is Tom Brady interested in Alix Earle?



Tom Brady, the NFL legend, has had a troubled personal life ever since his high profile divorce in 2022. While Tom Brady has been linked to numerous women since then and more recently, to Alix Earle, he has not entered into a serious relationship.But this time, fans are pretty excited about Tom Brady and Alix Earle‚Äôs potential romance after the two were spotted at a New Year‚Äôs Eve party. Amid all the mess, Tom Brady seems to be reminiscing about the past.A few hours ago, the NFL legend Tom Brady, took to his social media to post a heartfelt throwback picture of his daughter, Vivian, whom he shares with his ex wife, Gisele Bundchen.It seems Tom Brady is reminiscing about the past as he has participated in the ongoing ‚Äú2026 is the new 2016‚Äù trend. The picture is of his daughter playing with their dogs as Tom Brady wrote, ‚Äú2016‚Äù and ‚ÄúGirlie Girl‚Äù.This comes at a time after Tom Brady indirectly slammed all romance with Alix Earle after he spoke about his current focus in life.A few days ago, the Super Bowl champion spoke to PEOPLE as he said, "You know what? I don't have much time for a personal life or much time for myself but I love working and I love my kids."The NFL legend added, "I like to be busy and try to really stay fulfilled in the things I'm doing, so I'm working on some really cool projects and I'm involved with some great teams of people that are doing some really positive things.‚ÄùHowever, neither Tom Brady nor his rumored girlfriend, Alix Earle, have issued any statements after being spotted together in St. Barth‚Äôs.Amid all the mess, there have also been speculations that Tom Brady might not be interested in Alix Earle.A few days ago, as per Rob Schuter, a source said, Tom values discretion above everything else. He‚Äôs already suspicious about how these videos of him and Alix leaked. That‚Äôs a huge red flag.‚ÄùThe source added, ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs not interested in a girlfriend who broadcasts every detail of her life.‚Äù

The nfl legend seems to be reminiscing about the past as he posted a throwback picture of his daughter, vivian, whom he shares with his ex wife, gisele bundchen. This comes at a time when there have been speculations that tom brady might not be interested in alix.

Article Title: Anthony Joshua net worth timeline (2016 to 2026): How the British heavyweight champion built a million-dollar boxing empire
Article Text:
Anthony Joshua. Image via: Netflix

From Olympic gold to global business icon, Anthony Joshua's financial journey



Anthony Joshua has turned his boxing success into a legacy. From Olympic hero to global superstar, his rise over the past decade has been steady and powerful. Now, the British star is not only known for knockouts. He is also known for smart contracts, big-brand deals, and careful business moves. His net worth growth reflects consistency at the top level of sport.As of now, Anthony Joshua‚Äôs estimated net worth stands at around $150 million (per celebrity net worth). Some reports suggest it could rise closer to $200 million after his recent mega fights. His paycheques come from huge fight purses, global endorsements, and business investments. Joshua is now one of the richest boxers in the world.Anthony Joshua‚Äôs big payday journey began after his gold medal win at the 2012 London Olympics. By 2016, his professional career was booming. He won world titles and quickly became a box office star. His early title fights earned him millions and pushed his net worth into the tens of millions.The defining moment came in April 2017. Joshua defeated Wladimir Klitschko at Wembley Stadium.The fight made him a global name. It also delivered one of his first massive paydays. From that point, Joshua became a stadium fighter who could sell out any venue.Between 2017 and 2018, Joshua defended his titles against Carlos Takam, Joseph Parker, and Alexander Povetkin. Each fight brought eight-figure earnings. Sponsors followed. Brands like Under Armour, Beats by Dre, and Hugo Boss signed major deals with him. His clean image and athletic build made him highly marketable.In 2019, Joshua reached a financial peak. Although he lost to Andy Ruiz Jr. in June, the rematch later that year changed everything. He earned a reported $57.5 million in Saudi Arabia. This became the biggest payday of his career at the time. His net worth jumped sharply after that fight.Anthony Joshua faced setbacks in 2021 and 2022 with losses to Oleksandr Usyk. Still, the money kept flowing. His second fight against Usyk alone earned him over $40 million. Even in defeat, Joshua remained one of boxing‚Äôs highest-paid stars.From 2023 onward, Anthony Joshua rebuilt both his career and brand. Wins over Jermaine Franklin and Robert Helenius kept him active. In March 2024, he knocked out Francis Ngannou and earned around $50 million. This single fight added significantly to his wealth.By late 2025, reports claimed Joshua had earned over $195 million in total career income. His December 2025 fight vs Jake Paul was another big payday. This pushed his net worth toward $150 million.Outside the ring, Joshua has invested in real estate and business ventures through his company, 258 Group. These assets give him income beyond boxing. From 2016 to 2026, Anthony Joshua built his net worth with power and smart planning.Also Read: Kamaru Usman faces fans wrath after he releases video of Anthony Joshua‚Äôs emotional private call after tragic Nigeria crash
Article Summary: Anthony joshua is one of the richest boxers in the world. His net worth stands at around $150 million (per celebrity net worth) some reports suggest it could rise closer to $200 million after his recent mega fights. His paycheques come from huge fight purses, global endorsements, and business investments.

Article Title: Shark Tank India judge Anupam Mittal criticises Apple, Google and other Big Tech for ‚Äòmonetising brand keywords‚Äô: Read his LinkedIn post
Article Text:
Anupam Mittal celebrates legal victory of Shadi.com



What Anupam Mittal said on LinkedIn

I don't like to fight but if I have to, I go all in.

Last week, the Bombay High Court ruled in our favor against domain squatters misusing the Shaadi name üëäüèº

Not imitators.

Not competitors.

Straight-up lookalikes designed to confuse users and siphon trust. ‚öñÔ∏è

The judgment recognized Shaadi.com as a 'well-known TM' under Section 2(1)(zg) of the Trade Marks Act, 1999 & awarded costs of 25 lacs + interest.

Brands aren‚Äôt built on logos.

They‚Äôre built on decades of spend, consistency, customer faith, and restraint.

Yet squatters show up late, copy the recall, and free-ride.

Worse, globally, Big Tech has normalized this behavior by monetizing brand keywords and disintermediating the very cos that built demand in the 1st place. They Do More Evil üòà

So this judgment matters. A lot.

It says Indian courts are finally recognizing that IP is not a technicality.

It‚Äôs the economic engine of brand trust. üáÆüá≥

Huge win for us.

Bigger win for every Indian brand & legal pros playing the long game üí™üèº

Mittal also shared a similar post on X:



You don‚Äôt spend decades building a brand so squatters can free-ride on it.

The

Bombay High Court ruling

against http://Shaadi.com domain misuse is a big signal ‚Äî IP protection in India is finally getting real.

Good for brands. Long overdue.





Anupam Mittal, the founder of Shaadi.com and a judge on Shark Tank India, has criticised the Big Tech ‚Äì Google Apple , Amazon, Meta (Facebook) and Microsoft, accusing the of enabling digital ‚Äòfree-riders‚Äô to breach trust established by brands. In a viral LinkedIn post, Mittal not only celebrated a major legal victory in the Bombay High Court against domain squatters but used the decision to highlight how tech giants purportedly prioritise ad revenue over trademark integrity.Mittal‚Äôs post follows a judgment by the Bombay High Court that ruled in favour of Mittal‚Äôs People Group, saying that ‚Äúlookalike‚Äù entities are misusing the Shaadi name. The court recognised Shaadi.com as a ‚Äòwell-known trademark‚Äô under Section 2(1)(zg) of the Trade Marks Act, 1999, providing broader protection against infringement across all industries.
Article Summary: Anupam mittal celebrates legal victory of shadi.com against domain squatters. Mittal: big tech has normalized this behavior by monetizing brand keywords and disintermediating the very cos that built demand in the 1st place. He also used the decision to highlight how tech giants purportedly prioritise ad revenue over trademark integrity.

Article Title: Jeff Bezos' ex-wife MacKenzie Scott who sold half of her Amazon stake to donate may have sent millions to organisations under FBI investigation
Article Text:
Tired of too many ads? go ad free now

Tired of too many ads? go ad free now

What the Solidaire Network said about MacKenzie Scott‚Äôs donations

Tired of too many ads? go ad free now

Tired of too many ads? go ad free now

Tired of too many ads? go ad free now

Tired of too many ads? go ad free now

Amazon founder Jeff Bezos‚Äô ex-wife, MacKenzie Scott, recently cut down her stake at the company by nearly 50% to donate to charities. A report claims that the billionaire philanthropist donated millions of dollars to a funding network that supports organisations now facing FBI and congressional investigations over alleged ties to Hamas. In 2025, Scott reportedly donated $5 million, and in 2021, $10 million, to the Solidaire Network through her charity, Yield Giving. The network describes itself as connecting social movements with donors to build systems based on love and justice.However, Solidaire Network has funded groups such as Students for Justice in Palestine (SJP) and American Muslims for Palestine (AMP), according to tax records and press releases reviewed by Fortune. Both organisations are under investigation by the House and Senate for allegedly working with the terror group Hamas to organise anti-Israel protests in the United States.The House Committee on Oversight and Accountability sent a letter to AMP's executive director in May 2024 expressing concern that groups spreading pro-Hamas messages and breaking laws on college campuses may be receiving money from sources supporting Hamas or other terrorist organisations.US Senator Tom Cotton also asked the FBI in September 2025 to investigate the Palestinian Youth Movement (PYM), calling it hateful toward Jewish people after its leader, Aisha Nizar, urged supporters to disrupt the US F-35 fighter jet supply chain, the report noted.In a statement (shared by Fortune), Cotton said,Scott donated more than $7 billion in 2025 alone, bringing her total giving since 2020 to $26 billion across over 2,700 donations. With a net worth of about $40 billion, mostly from her divorce settlement, she ranks among the world's biggest donors alongside Bill Gates, Melinda French Gates, and Warren Buffett. Most of her 2025 donations supported diversity programmes, disaster relief, and colleges.It's important to note that the Solidaire Network also funds other progressive groups working on racial and gender equality, climate change, and economic fairness. Scott was also just one of more than 280 people who donated to Solidaire Network in 2021.the Solidaire Network noted.Around that time, Solidaire Network had just given out multimillion-dollar grants through its Black Liberation Pooled Fund, Movement Protection Fund, and Movement Infrastructure Fund.As Scott's donations have no restrictions, which means the receiving organisation can spend the money however it chooses, there's no proof that her 2021 or 2025 gifts went directly to SJP or AMP.On January 30, 2024, Solidaire Network also announced it started a Unity & Power Fund to support theSJP and AMP mainly focus onand firm opposition to Israel.Stacey Krueger of Palestine Legal said in a statement.While some people have criticised Scott's donation to Solidaire Network, she's widely recognised as one of the most impactful charitable donors in recent years. She's made a real difference for diversity-focused organisations and groups working on higher education, veterans' issues, social justice, disaster relief, and climate change.For example, Scott gave $80 million to Howard University last fall, and the school said the gift came at anas the US government shutdown delayed annual federal money the university receives to support students, academic programs, research, and hospital operations.Scott has also said her giving was inspired by her college roommate, who lent her $1,000 so she wouldn't have to quit school, and her dentist, who gave her free dental work after seeing her use denture glue to fix a broken tooth in college.In a blog post from December 2025, Scott wrote,Sotheby's International Realty said Scott has donated an estimated $14 billion to causes, including racial equality, LGBTQ+ equality, strengthening functional democracy, and climate action. She now ranks sixth on the list of the world's top 10 philanthropists, behind Bill Gates and Warren Buffett. The Sotheby's list adds that Scott's gifts support nonprofit groups working against racial injustice, advancing gender equality, and backing public health programs.
Article Summary: Mackenzie scott reportedly donated $5 million in 2025 and $10 million in 2021 to the solidaire network through her charity, yield giving. The network describes itself as connecting social movements with donors to build systems based on love and justice.

Article Title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang to engineers: I want you to stop coding and start...
Article Text:
Nvidia's CEO Jensen Huang aims for engineers to code zero percent, leveraging AI assistants like Cursor to tackle complex, undiscovered problems. He believes this 'Purpose vs Task' approach, akin to radiology's evolution, will elevate human roles. While some, like Cursor's CEO, caution against unchecked AI development, Huang remains confident in this human-centric future for innovation.

Why radiologists didn't disappear, and why engineers might not either

Vibe coding pioneers warn Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang ‚Äôs approach has limits





Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang wants his engineers to spend exactly zero percent of their time writing code. In a recent appearance on the No Priors AI podcast, Huang revealed that every engineer at the $3 trillion chipmaker now uses Cursor, an AI coding assistant, throughout their workday. His goal? Free them entirely from what he calls 'syntax' so they can focus on finding and solving problems that haven't been cracked yet."Nothing would give me more joy than if none of our engineers were coding at all," Huang said. "And they were just purely solving undiscovered problems."This isn't just philosophical musing. Huang has been pushing a framework he calls 'Purpose vs Task' across multiple interviews in recent months, including a viral appearance on The Joe Rogan Experience. The idea is simple: coding is the task, but discovering and solving novel problems is the purpose. AI should handle the former so humans can concentrate on the latter.Huang points to radiology as proof this approach creates jobs rather than eliminates them. Years ago, AI pioneer Geoffrey Hinton predicted radiologists would be obsolete within five years because computers could scan images faster than humans. Instead, radiologist numbers have grown.The reason, Huang argues, is that reading scans was always just a task‚Äîthe real purpose is diagnosing disease and improving patient outcomes. When AI took over the grunt work, demand for the human expertise behind it actually expanded.At Nvidia's recent all-hands meeting, Huang reportedly pushed back hard against managers who were telling teams to dial back AI usage. "Are you insane?" he said, according to Business Insider. He promised employees they'd still have work to do‚Äîjust more ambitious work, the report said.The push comes at a pivotal moment for software engineering. Google CEO Sundar Pichai recently revealed that AI now writes over 30% of new code at the company, while Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei claimed Claude generates 90% of his firm's code. Yet a METR study from July found AI assistants actually decreased experienced developers' productivity by 19%‚Äîeven though participants expected a 20% boost. The gap between hype and reality suggests Huang's vision of code-free engineers may be further out than his enthusiasm implies.Not everyone shares Huang's unbridled optimism. Michael Truell, CEO of Cursor itself‚Äîthe $29 billion startup whose AI tool Nvidia has embraced‚Äîrecently cautioned against 'vibe coding,' where developers let AI build software without reviewing the output. "If you close your eyes and don't look at the code and have AIs build things with shaky foundations, things start to kind of crumble," Truell told Fortune's Brainstorm AI conference.Even Andrej Karpathy, the former Tesla AI director who coined the term 'vibe coding,' admitted his recent Nanochat project was "basically entirely hand-written" because AI agents "just didn't work well enough." He recently warned fellow programmers: "I've never felt this much behind. The profession is being dramatically refactored."For now, the Nvidia CEO is betting big that humans who focus on purpose rather than tasks will come out ahead. Whether that bet pays off for the millions of developers who actually write code for a living remains the undiscovered problem.
Article Summary: Jensen huang, ceo of $3 trillion chipmaker nvidia, wants engineers to spend zero percent of their time writing code. His goal is to free them entirely from'syntax' so they can focus on finding and solving problems that haven't been cracked yet. He believes this 'purpose vs task' approach will elevate human roles.

Article Title: NYT Connections today‚Äôs hints and answers (#953) for 19 January 2026
Article Text:
What is NYT Connections





NYT Connections: Hints for today‚Äôs puzzle



YELLOW: Green behind the ears

GREEN: Loadsamoney

BLUE: Share same measurement prefix

PURPLE: Begin with a speedy word

NYT Connections categories for January 19, 2026

GREEN: ü§ë

NYT Connections answers for January 19, 2026

Connections by The New York Times has fast become an addiction for word game lovers around the world. Taking the addictive simplicity of games like Wordle and marrying it with the complexity of both logic and pattern recognition puzzles, Connections challenges gamers to find the subtle links between evidently random words. Day in and day out, 16 words are lined up every day in a 4x4 grid; the task is to group them into four sets based on hidden themes. Today's Connections puzzle, number 953, is from January 19, 2026. Players will find it an ideal balance between challenge and fun, testing knowledge and mental dexterity. Connections has gained a global following for its clever gameplay and ability to engage players in their analytical and lateral thinking skills, making it a daily intellectual exercise.Connections is more than a word association game. The game tests one's ability to recognise connections among words. The connections can range from very obvious classifications to very smart connections. Unlike other word games, one requires observation and strategy in order to win at Connections. The game can easily be accessed via desktop computers and mobile devices, and it's free, all of which contributes to its immense popularity.Players go on to add it to their daily routine and take pleasure in it as well as the satisfaction that comes with completing each puzzle.To help players without revealing the solution, here are some strategies for January 19, 2026:These hints guide players toward recognising patterns, encouraging logical deduction and strategic grouping without removing the challenge entirely.Here are the connection categories available today in the NYT Connections puzzle:Below are the four correct groups for today‚Äôs puzzle
Article Summary: Connections by the new york times has fast become an addiction for word game lovers around the world. Day in and day out, 16 words are lined up every day in a 4x4 grid; the task is to group them into four sets based on hidden themes. Unlike other word games, one requires observation and strategy in order to win at connections.

Article Title: OpenAI invests in Sam Altman‚Äôs Merge Labs, the brain-computer interface startup taking on Elon Musk‚Äôs Neuralink
Article Text:
What Merge Labs is building

OpenAI's Master Plan for India

Merge Labs vs Neuralink





ChatGPT-maker OpenAI has announced an investment in Merge Labs, a brain-computer interface (BCI) startup which was founded by OpenAI CEO Sam Altman. Rival to Elon Musk ‚Äôs Neuralink, the mission of Merge Labs is to develop safe and scaleable brain-computer interfaces. ‚ÄúWe are excited to support and collaborate with Merge Labs as they turn an ambitious idea into reality and ultimately products that are useful for people,‚Äù said the company.OpenAI revealed that funding made by the company will support Merge Labs‚Äô mission of creating safe, scalable brain-computer interfaces that could one day allow humans to interact with artificial intelligence directly through neural signals. The company has not yet disclosed the size of the investment, but the partnership underscores OpenAI‚Äôs growing interest in technologies that extend beyond software into hardware and human augmentation.Merge Labs is a research lab with the long-term mission of bridging biological and artificial intelligence to maximize human ability, agency, and experience. It is developing fundamentally new approaches‚Å† (opens in a new window) to BCIs that are safe and interface with the brain at much higher bandwidth by combining biology, devices, and AI.The company is focused on creating non-invasive neural interfaces that can translate brain activity into digital commands. Unlike more invasive approaches that require surgical implants, Merge Labs aims to build consumer-ready devices that are both accessible and ethically designed.The company‚Äôs early prototypes reportedly use advanced sensors and machine learning models to interpret neural signals, with potential applications ranging from medical rehabilitation to enhanced productivity tools.Elon Musk founded Neuralink in 2016 and till now the company has made significant progress in developing brain implants which enable people with paralysis to control devices with the help of their thoughts. The Elon Musk-owned company recently raised $600 million at a $9 billion valuation and is conducting human trials.Merge Labs on the other hand, is reportedly working on less invasive brain interfaces with a strong emphasis on AI-powered enhancements. The focus of the startup is not just medical rehabilitation but broader human-AI integration.‚ÄúI believe the merge has already started,‚Äù Altman wrote in a 2017 blog post. ‚ÄúWe will be the first species ever to design our own descendants‚Äù.
Article Summary: Merge labs is a brain-computer interface (bci) startup founded by openai ceo sam altman. The company is focused on creating non-invasive neural interfaces that can translate brain activity into digital commands. Unlike more invasive approaches that require surgical implants, merge labs aims to build consumer-ready devices.

Article Title: YouTuber MrBeast says ‚ÄúI have negative money‚Äù; cannot buy a McDonald‚Äôs meal despite $5 billion company valuation
Article Text:
YouTuber MrBeast

MrBeast‚Äôs 'Beast Industries' hits $5 billion valuation, but personal liquidity tells a different story



MrBeast‚Äôs Forbes net worth vs. personal cash



MrBeast: ‚ÄúI actually have negative money‚Äù



Focus on reinvesting, not personal savings



High-cost decisions driven by time constraints



MrBeast borrowed money for his wedding



Multiple ventures under the MrBeast brand







Jimmy Donaldson, widely known as MrBeast, is one of the most well-known people on YouTube. He runs a business and content empire that reaches hundreds of millions of people around the world, and he's only 27. His videos often have big challenges, giving back, and record-breaking prize money. People often think that MrBeast is personally wealthy in the traditional sense, with lots of money on hand, because of how he looks to the public. But a recent interview has brought a different side of his financial situation to light. Donaldson was honest about money and said that even though the company he started is worth billions, his own bank account tells a very different story. He said he has "negative money" and is currently borrowing money, even for big life events. His comments have brought attention to the differences between startup valuations, equity ownership, and personal liquidity, especially for founders who keep putting money into growth. The conversation gives us a better idea of how digital businesses work today and how money is often tied up on paper instead of cash.Beast Industries, MrBeast's main business, is at the heart of what he does.As per a report from Fortune in September 2025, the company is now worth $5 billion. Donaldson owns a little more than half of the company, which gives him a big stake in it. Beast Industries runs a number of businesses, such as making big YouTube videos, creating branded content, and making consumer goods. The value takes into account the company's reach, potential for revenue, and high levels of audience engagement across platforms.But the value of a company is not the same as the cash it has on hand. A valuation is what investors think the business is worth based on how much money it will make and how fast it will grow in the future. It is not the amount of money the founder has to spend every day.Forbes said that MrBeast's net worth was $85 million in June 2025. This number includes the estimated worth of his stake in Beast Industries, other business ventures, personal investments, and additional things he owns. Donaldson has made it clear that most of this net worth is tied up in stocks and company equity rather than readily available cash.He talked about common misconceptions and ideas about his wealth in an interview with The Wall Street Journal. He said that a lot of people incorrectly assume he is a billionaire, but that is because they often mix up his net worth with his liquid, spendable cash. He explained that it is not easy to use equity in a company for everyday expenses unless it is sold, converted, or leveraged, which he has deliberately chosen not to do to maintain long-term control.Donaldson said something very interesting about his finances during the interview. He said, "I really... I have negative money right now." I am borrowing money. He also said that if you take away the equity value of his company, many viewers would technically have more money in their bank accounts than he does.He gave a simple example to explain the situation, saying that company equity can't be used to buy a McDonald‚Äôs meal in the morning. This comment made it clear that there is a difference between wealth on paper and money you can actually spend.Donaldson said that his focus on work and growth affects how he handles his money. He said he doesn't think about his bank balance very often. Instead, he is focused on making videos and growing his businesses.He has said many times that a lot of the money he makes goes back into making more content. He says that spending on making content alone is expected to reach about $250 million in one year. This model of reinvesting in productions allows for more complicated works, bigger prizes, and higher production standards, which are now a defining feature of his brand.Donaldson has made some expensive spending choices when he needed to, even though he keeps a small personal account. He told one story about how he rented a private jet to see his fianc√©e, Thea Booysen, who was studying in the UK at the time.He said that because of where he lived and when he worked, commercial travel took a lot of time. It took a long drive and a lot of layovers to get to a big airport. Donaldson says that a private jet cut down on travel time a lot, which meant he could keep working without losing almost a whole day to travel. The flight is said to have cost about $150,000.Donaldson told people on social media in June 2025 that he had borrowed money from his mother to help pay for his wedding. He said that this happened because he put most of his money back into his businesses.He also pointed out how ironic it was that he owned companies worth billions of dollars but still needed short-term personal loans. He said again that even though the businesses look very valuable on paper, that value doesn't always turn into cash that you can use for yourself.Donaldson's business portfolio includes several big projects, not just YouTube videos. One of them is "Beast Games," a competition series that gave its first-season winner $10 million, which is one of the biggest single prizes in entertainment history. Feastables is another important business. It's a consumer brand that focuses on chocolate and snack foods, and it has grown quickly in retail markets.All of these projects need a lot of money up front. Donaldson's strategy of reinvesting rather than taking personal income is supported by high operating costs, which come from prize money, production costs, staffing, and logistics.
Article Summary: Jimmy donaldson, widely known as mrbeast, is one of the most well-known people on youtube. He runs a business and content empire that reaches hundreds of millions of people around the world. People often think that mrbeast is personally wealthy in the traditional sense, with lots of money on hand, because of how he looks to the public.

Article Title: Bill Gates warns: AI will change society and jobs faster than expected
Article Text:
Bill Gates (Image source: Reuters)

Big Tech's $70 Billion AI Move: Silicon Valley Bets On India, Snubs Trump's 'America First' Diktat

Bill Gates warning on AI and the pace of technological change

AI misuse risks highlighted by Bill Gates

Job market disruption from AI according to Bill Gates

How AI could change work patterns and productivity

Also read | Apple iPhone 17 Pro available for just Rs 85,700 at Amazon Great Republic Day Sale





Artificial intelligence is no longer something people only argue about in tech conferences or future forecasts. It is already quietly shaping daily life in profound and often unexpected ways. From customer support chats to recommendation engines, from coding tools to medical research, AI is now part of how work gets done efficiently. And according to Bill Gates , the pace of change is about to speed up even more dramatically.In his latest annual letter, The Year Ahead, the Microsoft co-founder lays out a clear message. AI will reshape society, economies, and jobs faster than most people expect. Gates says he remains optimistic about technology, but this time his optimism comes with serious warnings. The benefits are real. So are the risks. And ignoring either would be a grave mistake.Gates has spent decades watching technology alter economies and daily life. In his letter, he says AI is different from past waves of innovation. Not just faster, but broader. He argues that artificial intelligence could affect more parts of society than any previous human-made tool.He points to progress already happening. AI is accelerating disease research, improving climate modelling, and expanding access to digital education.Tasks that once took years can now be completed in months, sometimes weeks. For Gates, this is proof that AI can solve hard problems if used well.But he also stresses that hope alone is not a strategy. Institutions, governments, and workers are not fully prepared for how quickly these changes are arriving. Without planning, the speed of AI adoption could leave many people behind.One of Gates‚Äô biggest concerns is how AI could be misused. As advanced tools become more accessible, the barrier to harmful use drops. He has warned that open-source AI systems could be exploited by bad actors, including non-state groups.In particular, Gates has raised alarms about biological threats. He suggests that AI-assisted misuse could pose risks even greater than naturally occurring pandemics. That is not a casual statement. It reflects a growing fear among researchers that powerful tools, in the wrong hands, could scale harm faster than ever before.Gates argues that global cooperation is essential. Clear rules, oversight, and governance structures are needed. At the same time, he acknowledges the tension. Too many restrictions could slow beneficial innovation. Too little could invite danger. Finding the balance will not be easy.Jobs sit at the centre of Gates‚Äô warning. He says AI makes it possible to produce more goods and services with less human labour. That reality will change how companies hire and how work is valued.Some of this is already visible. In software development, AI tools help programmers write, test, and maintain code faster. Gates notes that developers can now be significantly more productive, which lowers costs and reshapes team structures.He also points to sectors like warehouse operations and phone-based customer service. As AI systems improve, these roles are likely to face pressure. Automation will not arrive all at once, but it will arrive steadily.Gates does not frame this as doom. He frames it as a disruption that needs preparation.Beyond job losses, Bill Gates talks about how work itself might change. If AI boosts productivity enough, shorter workweeks could become possible. The same output, fewer hours. It sounds appealing. But he is careful not to present it as automatic.Whether these gains benefit most people depends on policy choices. Who owns the productivity gains. How companies share them. Without thoughtful decisions, Gates warns that efficiency could concentrate wealth instead of spreading it.This is where governments and institutions matter. AI alone will not deliver fairness. People have to decide what to do with the gains it creates.
Article Summary: Gates says he remains optimistic about technology, but this time his optimism comes with serious warnings. He argues that artificial intelligence could affect more parts of society than any previous human-made tool. Gates argues that global cooperation is essential. Clear rules, oversight, and governance structures are needed.

Article Title: Elon Musk‚Äôs AI chatbot Grok banned from generating sexualised images
Article Text:
In response to mounting backlash and regulatory scrutiny, Grok AI has ceased the creation of explicit images of real individuals. xAI has introduced stringent technical measures to curb misuse, particularly addressing concerns around deepfake content involving women and minors. Furthermore, image generation and editing services are now reserved for paid X subscribers, with geoblocking mechanisms implemented to filter illegal material.

Govt Sends Notice To Elon Musk's X On Grok AI Chatbot Misuse, IT Ministry Seeks Action Report

Grok Banned from Generating Adult Images: Read the company‚Äôs statement here

‚ÄúSafety Commitment

We remain committed to making X a safe platform for everyone and continue to have zero tolerance for any forms of child sexual exploitation, non-consensual nudity, and unwanted sexual content.

We take action to remove high-priority violative content, including Child Sexual Abuse Material (CSAM) and non-consensual nudity, taking appropriate action against accounts that violate our X Rules. We also report accounts seeking Child Sexual Exploitation materials to law enforcement authorities as necessary.

Updates to [@]Grok Account

We have implemented technological measures to prevent the Grok account from allowing the editing of images of real people in revealing clothing such as bikinis.

This restriction applies to all users, including paid subscribers.

Additionally, image creation and the ability to edit images via the Grok account on the X platform are now only available to paid subscribers. This adds an extra layer of protection by helping to ensure that individuals who attempt to abuse the Grok account to violate the law or our policies can be held accountable.

Geoblock update

We now geoblock the ability of all users to generate images of real people in bikinis, underwear, and similar attire via the Grok account and in Grok in X in those jurisdictions where it‚Äôs illegal.

X Rules

This does not change our existing safety protocol that all AI prompts and generated content posted to X must strictly adhere to our X Rules. However content is created or whether users are free or paid subscribers, our Safety team are working around the clock to add additional safeguards, take swift and decisive action to remove violating and illegal content, permanently suspend accounts where appropriate, and collaborate with local governments and law enforcement as necessary.

For more information on our policies, please refer to our

and

. The rapid evolution of generative AI presents challenges across the entire industry. We are actively working with users, our partners, governing bodies and other platforms to address issues more rapidly as they arise.‚Äù

Grok AI restricts image editing features to paid X users

Elon Musk warns, ‚ÄòAnyone using Grok to make illegal content will ‚Ä¶‚Äô





Grok the AI chatbot of Elon Musk‚Äôs artificial intelligence firm xAI will no longer be able to generate sexualised or revealing images of real people. The company took this decision after the mounting criticism and regulatory scrutiny. In a post blog post share on social media platform X (formerly known as Twitter), the company company confirmed that it has implemented technological measures in to order to prevent Grok account from allowing the editing of images of real people. This move of the company comes after Grok users were exploiting the tool to create AI deepfakes of women and minors, undressing them in manipulated images.California Attorney General Rob Bonta revealed he had launched an investigation into Grok‚Äôs role in producing sexualized deepfakes, citing a flood of complaints in recent weeks. Meanwhile, Indonesia and Malaysia suspended Grok entirely, becoming the first countries to ban the tool. Lawmakers in the UK have also publicly considered a suspension.In a statement posted on X‚Äôs safety account the company wrote:Recently, Tesla CEO Elon Musk‚Äôs AI chatbot Grok, integrated into his social media platform X (formerly known as Twitter), has now announced that its image generation and editing tools will now be restricted to paying subscribers. Image generation and editing are currently limited to paying subscribers. You can subscribe to unlock these features,‚Äù Grok posted late January 8, linking to X‚Äôs premium membership page.Elon Musk said that anyone using AI chatbot Grok to make illegal content on his platform X (formerly known as Twitter) will be punished. Musk‚Äôs comments came after the chatbot ‚Äì hardwired into X came under fire for producing obscene/ non-consensual images, including women and children. In an online post, the tech billionaire wrote ‚ÄúAnyone using Grok to make illegal content will suffer the same consequences as if they upload illegal content‚Äù. The Tesla CEO was responding to a post on ‚Äúinappropriate images‚Äù generated by grok.DogeDesigner, followed by Elon Musk wrote in the post: ‚ÄúSome people are saying Grok is creating inappropriate images. But that‚Äôs like blaming a pen for writing something bad. A pen doesn‚Äôt decide what gets written. The person holding it does. Grok works the same way. What you get depends a lot on what you put in. Think about it!‚Äù.
Article Summary: Elon musk‚Äôs ai chatbot grok, integrated into his social media platform x (formerly known as twitter), has now announced that its image generation and editing tools will now be restricted to paying subscribers. This comes after grok users were exploiting the tool to create ai deepfakes of women and minors, undressing them in manipulated images.

Article Title: All is not well between Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg and Meta's highest-paid employee as the company's new reporting structure shows
Article Text:
Meta's new reporting structure reveals friction between Mark Zuckerberg and Alexandr Wang, his $14 billion hire. Wang finds Zuckerberg's micromanagement suffocating, while staff question his leadership of Meta's AI ambitions. A recent restructuring centralizes infrastructure decisions above Wang, indicating Zuckerberg's desire for tighter control over the company's significant AI investments.

Wang's inexperience becomes liability for Mark Zuckerberg as AI race intensifies

Meta reorganizes infrastructure chain of command above Wang





Meta's newest reporting structure is exposing something leadership has tried to hide‚Äîfriction between CEO Mark Zuckerberg and his highest-paid employee, Alexandr Wang. Multiple sources close to the company reveal that Wang, the 28-year-old founder Zuckerberg recruited for $14 billion, finds the CEO's hands-on management suffocating. At the same time, current staff question whether Wang has the chops to lead Meta's $600 billion AI bet.The tension surfaced this fall during a crucial meeting. Wang's TBD Lab team and longtime executives Chris Cox and Andrew Bosworth clashed over strategy. Cox and Bosworth wanted Wang's new AI model trained on Instagram and Facebook data to boost the company's core advertising business. Wang pushed back hard. He argued the goal should be catching up to OpenAI and Google's models first, worrying that customizing training for product tasks would slow progress.It's an us-versus-them mentality that's become impossible to ignore inside Meta. Wang's researchers view the old guard as mere product managers stuck in the social media era. They're chasing superintelligence while everyone else cares about feeds and ads. Some staff even questioned whether $2 billion was quietly shifted from Bosworth's Reality Labs budget to Wang's team‚Äîthough Meta's spokesperson denied the figure, the whispers persist.The cracks widened when Yann LeCun, Meta's legendary AI scientist and a Turing Award winner, bolted in November rather than report to Wang. Sources say LeCun bristled at serving under someone whose background was data labeling, not cutting-edge AI research. Before that, Nat Friedman, another big hire, faced pressure to move faster. The rushed launch of Vibes, Meta's AI video feed, frustrated his team who felt forced to compete with OpenAI's Sora before they were ready.Wang told associates that Zuckerberg's micromanagement feels suffocating. Yet here's the irony‚ÄîZuckerberg hired him specifically because he needed someone he could control, someone young and ambitious enough to execute his vision of "personal superintelligence." The CEO's reputation for obsessing over chosen projects means TBD Lab gets his undivided attention. That laser focus looks less like support and more like surveillance, the report said.This week, Zuckerberg announced Meta Compute, a new top-level initiative reporting directly to him. He's putting Santosh Janardhan and Daniel Gross in charge, with Dina Powell McCormick handling government relations. The move effectively centralizes infrastructure decisions above Wang, suggesting Zuckerberg wants tighter control as Meta burns through billions. If Wang thought he had autonomy, this announcement proved otherwise. The company's trajectory suggests Zuckerberg's betting everything on AI‚Äîand he's not delegating that to a 28-year-old anymore.The restructuring carries real risks. Wang's TBD Lab only lost two researchers during their first vesting period in November, suggesting the team still has some loyalty. But the organizational shuffle sends a message that nobody‚Äînot even the $14 billion hire‚Äîoperates without Zuckerberg's constant oversight. Scale AI, the startup Zuckerberg invested in to poach Wang, is already losing credibility in the market. Private investors have slashed its valuation from $29 billion to as low as $7.3 billion. If Wang's leadership at Meta falters, it raises uncomfortable questions: did Zuckerberg overpay for the wrong person, or is he simply incapable of trusting anyone with real power?
Article Summary: Alexandr wang, meta's highest-paid employee, finds mark zuckerberg's hands-on management suffocating. Staff question whether wang has the chops to lead meta's $600 billion ai bet. Wang's researchers view the old guard as mere product managers stuck in the social media era.

Article Title: Microsoft‚Äôs first Windows 11 update of 2026 triggers shutdown bug, company issues emergency fix
Article Text:
Microsoft‚Äôs response to the bug



Here‚Äôs the changelog of the update



Connection and authentication failures in remote connection applications: This issue affects multiple platforms including Windows 11, version 25H2; Windows 10, version 22H2 ESU; and Windows Server 2025. See the bottom of this message for the complete list of affected products.

Devices with Secure Launch might fail to shut down or hibernate: This issue only affects Windows 11, version 23H2.

Windows 11, versions 25H2 and 24H2 (KB5077744)

Windows 11, version 23H2 (KB5077797)

Windows 10, version 22H2 ESU and Windows 10 Enterprise LTSC 2021 (KB5077796)

Windows Server 2025 (KB5077793)

Windows Server 2022 (KB5077800)

Windows Server 2019 and Enterprise LTSC 2019 (KB5077795)





Microsoft recently rolled out the first Windows 11 update of the year. However, the first Windows 11 update for the year 2026 caused unexpected trouble to some users as it prevented the affected computers from shutting down or restarting properly. According to Microsoft‚Äôs Windows Message Center, the issue stetted from an out-of-band update released in mid-January 2026. After installing the patch, some Windows 11 devices failed to complete shutdown or restart operations leaving users stuck with systems that remained powered on despite attempts to turn them off.Microsoft has acknowledged the bug and has confirmed that it was linked to the KB5034763 update. The company also rolled out a fix for the issue and noted that the problem was caused by a compatibility issue in the update process. The company also advised the affected users install the latest cumulative update, which resolves the shutdown and restart failures. Microsoft also stressed that the bug did not affect data integrity or boarder system performance.Take Action: Out-of-band update to address issues observed with the January 2026 Windows security updateMicrosoft has identified issues upon installing the January 2026 Windows security update.To address these issues, an out-of-band (OOB) update was released today, January 17, 2026.The out-of-band (OOB) update was released today, January 17, 2026, in the Microsoft Update Catalog . If you have not yet deployed the January 2026 Windows security update and your IT environment includes the affected applications and features, we recommend applying this OOB update instead. For more information and installation instructions, refer to the appropriate KB article for each affected version of Windows listed below. For additional guidance, see How to download updates from the Microsoft Update Catalog
Article Summary: Microsoft has acknowledged the bug and has confirmed that it was linked to the kb5034763 update. The company also rolled out a fix for the issue and noted that the problem was caused by a compatibility issue in the update process. Microsoft also advised the affected users install the latest cumulative update, which resolves the shutdown and restart failures.

Article Title: Hack of the day: Save up to 80% on bills using generic med app
Article Text:
The Times of India' brings you 'Hack of the Day'‚Äîa new weekday series of quick, practical solutions to everyday hassles. Each hack is designed to save you time, money or stress, using tools and features within your reach‚Äîfrom government websites to everyday apps.

In simple words it is: Simple fixes for smarter living.

What this solves



What to do



Step-by-Step Guide



Search the medicine: Enter the branded medicine name from your prescription or its salt/molecule name in the app. Find the generic equivalent: The app will display the Janaushadhi version, often priced up to 80% lower. Locate a store: Use the ‚ÄúLocate Store‚Äù feature to find the nearest Pradhan Mantri Bhartiya Janaushadhi Kendra. Verify quality: Check the ‚ÄúMedicine Lab Test‚Äù section in the app to confirm the batch quality before purchase.





Healthcare costs can add up quickly, especially when prescriptions involve expensive branded medicines. But there‚Äôs a simple way to cut your medical bills by as much as 80% ‚Äî by switching to affordable, high-quality generics using the Janaushadhi Sugam mobile app.Many patients end up paying more for branded drugs even when safe, approved generic versions are available. This hack helps you find cheaper alternatives without compromising on quality, ensuring your money isn‚Äôt wasted.Download the Janaushadhi Sugam app (available on Android and iOS). With just a few taps, you can search for your prescribed medicine and discover its Janaushadhi equivalent along with the nearest store where it‚Äôs available.
Article Summary: Janaushadhi sugam is a mobile app that lets you search for and buy generic medicines. The app will display the generic version, often priced up to 80% lower. Check the ‚Äúmedicine lab test‚Äù section in the app to confirm the batch quality before purchase.

Article Title: The UK is watering down plans for mandatory digital ID cards after a backlash
Article Text:
File photo: UK PM Keir Starmer (Picture credit: AP)





LONDON: The British government has watered down plans for mandatory digital identification cards, a contentious idea it had touted as a way to help control immigration.It's the latest policy U-turn by Prime Minister Keir Starmer's embattled center-left government, which is under fire from both opposition politicians and governing Labour Party lawmakers.Officials confirmed Wednesday that it won't be compulsory for citizens and residents to show a digital ID card in order to get a job, ditching a key plank of the policy announced in September."The digital ID could be one way you prove your eligibility to work," Transport Secretary Heidi Alexander told the BBC, alongside other documents such as biometric passports.The government said detailed plans for digital ID cards will be "set out following a full public consultation which will launch shortly."Starmer announced in September that "you will not be able to work in the United Kingdom if you do not have digital ID. It's as simple as that."He said the plan would help reduce unauthorized immigration by making it harder for people to work in the underground economy. He said it would also make it simpler for people to access health care, welfare, child care and other public services.He faced an immediate backlash, with polls suggesting support for digital ID plummeted after Starmer backed the idea.Britain has not had compulsory identity cards for ordinary citizens since shortly after World War II, and the idea has long been contentious. Civil rights campaigners argue it infringes personal liberty and puts people's information at risk.Former Prime Minister Tony Blair tried to introduce biometric ID cards two decades ago as a way of fighting terrorism and fraud, but the plan was abandoned after strong opposition from the public and Parliament.After the latest policy shift, opposition Conservative Party chairman Kevin Hollinrake said that "Labour's only consistent policy is retreat." Liberal Democrat spokeswoman Lisa Smart said Starmer's office "must be bulk-ordering motion sickness tablets at this rate to cope with all their U-turns."
Article Summary: The british government has watered down plans for mandatory digital identification cards. It's the latest policy u-turn by prime minister keir starmer's embattled center-left government. Officials confirmed wednesday that it won't be compulsory for citizens and residents to show a digital id card in order to get a job.

Article Title: China says it has deal with EU on steps to resolve their dispute over EV imports
Article Text:
Trump‚Äôs Russia-China Threat To Greenland ‚ÄòLIE‚Äô Exposed; Nordics Say 'No Ships Around Arctic Island'





HONG KONG: China said on Monday it has reached a deal with the European Union on exports of Chinese-made electric vehicles to the bloc.The commerce ministry in Beijing said the EU will be issuing guidelines on minimum pricing for Chinese auto exporters. It did not directly mention if the deal involved an end to the tariffs of up to 35.3 per cent that the EU imposed on imports of Chinese EVs in 2024 following an investigation.The expansion of Chinese EV makers overseas has alarmed automakers in Europe and the US. The EU imposed the tariffs to counter an influx of affordably priced Chinese EV models into its markets, saying Chinese automakers had benefited from unfair government subsidies. The US enacted a 100 per cent tariff on China-made electric cars in 2024.
Article Summary: China said on monday it has reached a deal with the european union on exports of chinese-made electric vehicles to the bloc. The eu will be issuing guidelines on minimum pricing for chinese auto exporters. It did not directly mention if the deal involved an end to the tariffs of up to 35.3 per cent that the eu imposed on imports of chinese evs in 2024.
